name: Hotel Jamaican Colors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This little gem set far away from mainstream tourism is truly a diamond in the rough! The owner's took care of our every need including an air conditioner at a moments notice and we didn't even have to change cottages. Food is exceptional and I highly recommend the lobster and the jerk chicken! There are many sights to see that are a short drive away and they will provide transportation if need be. No hassles, no problems and the owners/staff are exceptional!!
reviews.title: A True Gem

reviews.text: I too stayed at this hotel but in 2007. At the time they still only had the main house that sleeps 6, which I stayed in with my son for an amazing rate. They also had at that point two or three other bungalows I think but work was taking place to begin building more. It is nice to see they have completed much of that work and put up a few more accommodations on site.
reviews.title: I absolutely loved it too and often dream of living in a place like this

reviews.text: I have to agree that it was a very lovely time spent there and I would most definitely go back. In fact I am thinking of taking a trip to Jamaica early next year and intend to book a reservations with these guys.
reviews.title: A Colorful Little Jamaican Gem!

likes.liked: — Casual, relaxed, comfortable atmosphere; friendly hosts; beautiful surroundings
likes.disliked: — Only Hurricane Gustav which was Mother Nature's fault!

reviews.title: Decent place to stay
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I decided based on the reviews to stay here and it was what I had expected, not so much for my boyfriend. I guess he felt it was a bit too rustic for him. The owners were very nice and accommodating especially when our fan didn't work so well. We stayed two nights when we really only needed to stay one night because we were not impressed at all with Port Antonio. Guess we expected it to be a bit more like Montego Bay or even Ocho Rios but instead found a very quiet town. Having been to several other cities in Jamaica we decided to give Port Antonio a try, oh well, we won't be going back. As for the hotel, not bad if you want to relax by the pool and catch a breeze from the cliffside. Beware of mosquitos at night cause they are very hungry. Oh also nice that they have wifi cause that kept us entertained.

Going around the island by car we stayed for one night in one of the cottages at Jamaican colors. What a place to stay! For real the best spot we stayed in. Based on a cliff, there are several cottages to sleep in. Don't expect luxuary, but just what we were looking for. No hassle but just relaxation on a superspot. Swimmingpool, hammocks, beds, great views, bar and good food. What more do you need? Beach? Only a short drive by taxi.
reviews.title: Top place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall Port Antonio is a more pleasant area to stay if you want to get out of the mass-tourism, like in Negril or Ocho Rios. In comparison to those places Jamaican colors will feel like a culture clash in a good way!
reviews.title: Hotel Jamaica Colors, one of my favorites in Jamaica

reviews.text: I love Hotel Jamaica Colors. I have spent many days and a few nights there over the last few years. It is owned by a lovely French couple, who have been in Jamaica for while now. Their food is great- and is one of the reasons why my husband and I go their regularly when we are in Jamaica. There is no easy beach access, but they have a pool and a beautiful view. If you want to get away from it all, I would highly recommend a stay on the eastern side of the island and at Hotel Jamaica Colors. I have lived and traveled all over the island, and this is still one of my favorite places.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay!

reviews.text: We spent three nights in Jamaican Colors. It is very beautiful place, on the top of the cliff in a strategic position: you can easily get all the touristic attraction nearby (falls, port Antonio, Boston bay, Winnifred beach and frenchman's cove).
reviews.title: def nicest place we stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very accommodating place that is tucked out of the way and off the beaten path. Villas are very clean and the property is beautiful. If you are looking for "high end" accommodations, go to a resort! If you are looking for a true experience with marvelous people, views, and close proximity to beaches, stay here! Since there is so much luscious foliage and beautiful flowering trees on the property, I recommend bringing mosquito spray if you are staying during the summer months.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hidden Surprise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Jamaican Colors in September of 2009 and fell in love with it and just had to go back this past December. Martine, Bob, and Romain are always very nice and accomodating from the minute you arrive. A couple in our group asked if it was possible to get an air conditioner and they had it installed by the time we got back from our adventures that same day.
reviews.title: Our little piece of heaven :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the swimming pool, hot, tub, restaurant/bar, and their own private cove, you have everything you'd need if you want to stay on the serene property and just relax. The grounds are beautiful and there are photo opportunities everywhere you turn. If you are an adventurer there are several places within driving distance that make for a amazing day! While there we visited our favorite places - Jerk Alley to pick up some of our favorite jerk, Reach Falls, Bath natural hot springs, and even the Blue Lagoon - what a dream! Romain is always willing to set up a time to take you or tell you the best places to go and things to do.
reviews.title: Great deal!

reviews.text: Even the Rasta and Rocket, the wonderful pets on the grounds, will take a stroll down to the cove with you to keep you company. The food is priced well and always delicious! The bungalows are always kept very clean, are really comfortable, and have hot and cold water. This is definitely one of our favorite places on the island and somewhere I will always come back to :-) It's a little piece of heaven!
reviews.title: A small heaven on earth !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Martine, Bob, and Romain for always being an unforgettable part of our adventures :-) Hope to see you again soon!
reviews.title: Remote, Quiet , Excellent.

reviews.text: We stayed at Jamaican color for one week in February 2012 during our 3 week stay in Jamaica.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all i need to mention that we have arranged with them to come pick us up on the airport in Kingston but our flight was first delayed and then because of some unnecessary problems at the airport (If its possible fly to Montego bay and not in Kingston) we were around 2 hours late and we were realy scared that our ride wont be waitting for us anymore (let me mention that it was around 11pm) but when we finally got out of the airport Romain was still there waitting for us, most people wouldnt.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the hotel, its perfect, i loved the bungalows, they have everything u need and more, the pool and the restaurant are just a couple of steps away, they have a stunning view and perfect surroundings. When we came to Kingston we were a bit freaked out but Portland is the place to experience Jamaica. I need to say that in 3 weeks we traveled all of the Jamaica and there is no place like this one. Everything is green, no massive tourism, you can feel the real Jamaica and real Jamaicans, go to the best beaches on the island. Romain was right, Winifred beach realy is the best beach in whole Jamaica and we've been to every single one of them, 7 mile beach in Negril doesnt even come close. Also awesome bars on the beach with best bar mans, delicious food!
reviews.title: One love my home away home.....
It was wonderful!!
reviews.text: I cant talk highly enough about this hotel, we loved it there, we are only sorry we didnt stay there more than a week because this part of Jamaica realy is the best part, unless ofcourse ure a fan of big crowded hotels with millions of tourists.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Romain will take you anywhere u wanna go, but a minute walk from the hotel u can catch a Jamaican taxi, driving in one of them realy is an experience so dont miss it:D and they are realy cheap, nothing more than 100 jamaican dolars which equals 1US.
reviews.title: Love the place, love the people that run it, so friendly,all good!love the parish. Maximum respect to Romain,Martine,Bob

description: Jamaican Colors is a small rustic hiding spot where a lot of travelers love to stop by. It is unique, romantic, has his own Colors style, luxurious & very peaceful garden, natural. Facing and overlooking at the Caribbean sea on the cliff (30m/100ft high) It is perfect for short or long relaxation stay... 6 bungalows are on the property, all have private bathroom, terrace, double(s) bed(s). No TV are in the rooms, but the hotel provide free WIFI even in the rooms. There is a swimming pool, a cocktail bar and also a restaurant with a large menu & tasty food cooked to order. Prices are very reasonable. Hammocks are of course around the pool, it would not be perfect holidays without them, beds and seating style for full relaxation time. A complimentary breakfast is offered with the room, in buffet style by the pool side. It is your home away from home in a paradise & tropical touch...
